result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing, and Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations.

Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in court by phone. Court - $443 unpaid court obligations.  Mr. Grotto - would like payment plan.  Court - extend probation for 6 months or enter civil judgment.  Court orders judgment entered in the amount of $443.00.
Probation review hearing on November 16, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Probation review hearing on November 8, 2016 at 11:45 am.

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proff of Submission

10:50 Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Thorie files amended information plead to count 1 in amended information.  Recommends s/w probation 1 yr, court costs.  Expungment after probabtion sucessfully completed.  Chapman agrees.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant .  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended charge in information.  Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Court orders S/W probation 1 year conditions: court costs to be paid over probation, DNA Surcharge $200, if Defendant successfully completes probation expungment will be granted.
Plea hearing at 11-17-2015 10:00 am.
from Atty Chapman asking hearing be rescheduled due to an injury
Pre-trial conference at 09-24-2015 01:45 pm

3:35  Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in court from th jail via video conf.  with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie asks to have the bond reinstate.  Court orders the $5000 signature bond is reinstated. Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 08-18-2015 11:00 am.

Thorie files information; Defendants have a copy. Court reads charges and maximum penalties on both cases. Both defendants waiver further reading. Marshall Grotto pleas not guilty to charges. Chandra Pickett pleas not guilty. Court receives not guilty pleas. Attorney's to get new hearing dates.

11:11 a.m.  Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chandra Mae Pickett in court with attorney T Gregory Amann for Case 2015CF110 .  Preliminary hearing to be held together for 15CF108 and 15CF110.  Thorie calls Officer Thomas Koen.  Koen is sworn and takes the stand.  Thorie examines Officer Koen.  Koen identifies defendants Marshall Grotto and Chandra Pickett.  Chapman x-ex Koen.  Amann x-ex Koen. Sgt Eric Michels is swn, ex by Thorie. ID's Chandra Pickett and Marshall Grotto. Atty Chapman x ex Sgt Michels. Atty Amann x ex Sgt Michels.  Atty Chapman gives argument; no bind over. Atty Amann gives argument and requests dismissal. Atty Thorie gives argument.  Court: entry to the building is clear; private property. finds the defendants probably commited a felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Chapman addresses consent issue and hearsay. Atty Thorie responds.
Defendant's
DC
Preliminary hearing at 07-21-2015 11:00 am
Def waives his right to have his preliminary hearing within 20 days.

4:50 Defendant Marshall Ellery James D Grotto in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $5000 sign bond. Nelson: no objection. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
